commit_message:
Add systemd unit for sushy emulator in devstack

Change-Id: I6d463dace526a514dcba1bf6a4b24d82b115fda4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/22/644822/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_SYSTEMD_SERVICE="devstack@redfish-emulator.service" local gunicorn=gunicorn pip_install_gr gunicorn local cmd=$(which $gunicorn) cmd+=" sushy_tools.emulator.main:app" cmd+=" --bind "${HOST_IP}:${IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_PORT}" cmd+=" --env FLASK_DEBUG=1" write_user_unit_file $IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_SYSTEMD_SERVICE "$cmd" "" "root" $SYSTEMCTL enable $IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_SYSTEMD_SERVICE $SYSTEMCTL start $IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_SYSTEMD_SERVICE $SYSTEMCTL stop $IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_SYSTEMD_SERVICE $SYSTEMCTL disable $IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_SYSTEMD_SERVICE local unitfile="$SYSTEMD_DIR/$IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_SYSTEMD_SERVICE" sudo rm -f $unitfile $SYSTEMCTL daemon-reload
deleted_lines: IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_PID_FILE=${IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_PID_FILE:-/var/run/redfish-emulator.pid} gunicorn=gunicorn pip_install_gr "gunicorn" sudo $gunicorn sushy_tools.emulator.main:app --bind "${HOST_IP}:${IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_PORT}" \ --pid "$IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_PID_FILE" --daemon if [ -f $IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_PID_FILE ]; then sudo kill `cat $IRONIC_REDFISH_EMULATOR_PID_FILE` || true fi

commit_message:
add libpq-dev to build psycopg2

Without libpq-dev installed you get the following error message with
psycopg2-2.8.1

Error: You need to install postgresql-server-dev-X.Y for building a
server-side extension or libpq-dev for building a client-side application.

Change-Id: I5e0f6246d010e09065815e9fca5ad2c4da5060b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/77/651377/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: VNX: update sg in cache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-27 09:14:54.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vnx/mocked_vnx.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/vnx-update-sg-in-cache-3ecb673727bea79b.yaml', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vnx/adapter.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vnx/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/187016c2852533c1806c7fdb34aa8dc6dfcd528e', 'message': "VNX: update sg in cache

When `destroy_empty_storage_group` is enabled, the sg will be deleted
after the last lun is detached from it. The issue is that the sg cache
isn't updated, which caused the failure of subsequent attaching volumes
to the same host because the sg in the cache will be used directly which
doesn't exist any more.

The fix is updating the sg with poll after deleting it. This doesn't
delete the sg from cache explicitly but makes sure the sg in cache with
latest status `not-exist`. Subsequent attaching will create the sg if it
is `not-exist`.

Closes-bug: #1817385
Change-Id: Ibb39879a77c97c6a5d885461e93116810d16b265
(cherry picked from commit eefd8302b3a01fd5cff0169b6eca0588975ff244)

commit_message:
VNX: update sg in cache

When `destroy_empty_storage_group` is enabled, the sg will be deleted
after the last lun is detached from it. The issue is that the sg cache
isn't updated, which caused the failure of subsequent attaching volumes
to the same host because the sg in the cache will be used directly which
doesn't exist any more.

The fix is updating the sg with poll after deleting it. This doesn't
delete the sg from cache explicitly but makes sure the sg in cache with
latest status `not-exist`. Subsequent attaching will create the sg if it
is `not-exist`.

Closes-bug: #1817385
Change-Id: Ibb39879a77c97c6a5d885461e93116810d16b265
(cherry picked from commit eefd8302b3a01fd5cff0169b6eca0588975ff244)
(cherry picked from commit 1f57f502c893a840ee5021fbca36ae95eed50e73)
(cherry picked from commit 29d42fa73448b3d23d9da4db7b2f407694681ece)
(cherry picked from commit dcfc2f3d5ac69e0fd0c6ecbdd6ce26ed1cecd96c)

added_lines: from distutils import versionimport yaml def get_bmc_v6address(self): raise errors.IncompatibleHardwareMethodError() hardware_info['bmc_v6address'] = self.get_bmc_v6address() def get_bmc_v6address(self): """Attempt to detect BMC v6 address :return: IPv6 address of lan channel or ::/0 in case none of them is configured properly """ # These modules are rarely loaded automatically utils.try_execute('modprobe', 'ipmi_msghandler') utils.try_execute('modprobe', 'ipmi_devintf') utils.try_execute('modprobe', 'ipmi_si') null_address = '::/0' def get_dynamic(_channel): out, e = utils.execute("ipmitool lan6 print {} " "dynamic_addr".format(_channel), shell=True) out = out.strip() if not out: return # NOTE: More likely ipmitool was not intended to return # stdout in yaml format. Fortunately, output of # dynamic_addr and static_addr commands is a valid yaml. out = yaml.safe_load(out) for address_dict in out.values(): _address = address_dict['Address'] if address_dict['Status'] == 'active' \ and _address != null_address: return _address def get_static(_channel): out, e = utils.execute("ipmitool lan6 print {} " "static_addr".format(_channel), shell=True) out = out.strip() if not out: return out = yaml.safe_load(out) for address_dict in out.values(): _address = address_dict['Address'] if address_dict['Status'] == 'active' \ and address_dict['Enabled'] == 'yes' \ and _address != null_address: return _address try: req_v = '1.8.18' cur_v, e = utils.execute("ipmitool -V | awk '{print $NF}'", shell=True) cur_v = cur_v.strip() if version.StrictVersion(cur_v) < version.StrictVersion(req_v): LOG.warning('Cannot get BMC v6 address. ipmitool version %s ' 'does not support lan6 subcommand to handle ' 'IPv6 LAN parameters. Need version %s or later', cur_v, req_v) return null_address # From all the channels 0-15, only 1-7 can be assigned to different # types of communication media and protocols and effectively used for channel in range(1, 8): addr_mode, e = utils.execute( r"ipmitool lan6 print {} enables | " r"awk '/IPv6\/IPv4 Addressing Enables[ \t]*:/" r"{{print $NF}}'".format(channel), shell=True) if addr_mode.strip() not in ['ipv6', 'both']: continue # Dynamic address has higher priority? address = get_dynamic(channel) or get_static(channel) if not address: continue try: address = str(netaddr.IPNetwork(address).ip) except netaddr.AddrFormatError: LOG.warning('Invalid IP address: %s', address) continue return address except (processutils.ProcessExecutionError, OSError) as e: # Not error, because it's normal in virtual environment LOG.warning("Cannot get BMC v6 address: %s", e) return return null_address

commit_message:
Require admin privilege to retrieve some fields

* Skip container fields 'image_pull_policy', 'runtime', 'privilege'
  if users don't have admin privilege because only admin should
  view those fields.
* Skip capsule field 'host' if users don't have admin privilege.

Change-Id: Ib414b24de676ae62d06fa08d8e8102141a40219a

commit_message:
Force image pull policy to always

This is required in a multitenant environment so that users can be
assured that their private images can only be used by those who have
the credentials to pull them. If image pull policy is not always,
once an image has been pulled to a node, any container from any user
can use it simply by knowing the image’s name without any authorization
check against the image.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/650591/
Change-Id: I1521a0d5089437ac658ee367fadb5b6bec72276f

commit_message:
Run devstack CA and cert setup early

Previously apache was configured and restarted before we configured
the CA and certs. In most cases this is fine because those specific
vhosts didn't use tls. However, if you had previously run devstack
and had leftover vhosts and an unconfigured CA or certs devstack would
fail.

This is a small corner case, but its simple to address by moving CA and
cert setup up in stack.sh to before we do anything related to web
servers.

Change-Id: I31dbaf9471088b9faff26c7b790da6f6feebb2d5

With the default network_data.yaml and default roles_data.yaml

only the jinja2 rendered templates still include all the nets.

With change: https://review.openstack.org/645159 the vlan
parameter is passed to NIC configs for all networks enabled
for the role in roles data if networks data define a vlan id.

template unless networks data and roles data are customized.
(i.e networks that are'nt actually used are removed from the

commit_message:
Add {{network.name}}NetworkVlanID to THT/net-config-*

With the default network_data.yaml and default roles_data.yaml
all composable networks are included. When deploying plain
defaults without any network-isolation, i.e ctlplane network
only the jinja2 rendered templates still include all the nets.

With change: https://review.openstack.org/645159 the vlan
parameter is passed to NIC configs for all networks enabled
for the role in roles data if networks data define a vlan id.

Because of this we need to add the parameter to the nic config
template unless networks data and roles data are customized.
(i.e networks that are'nt actually used are removed from the
roles data and networks data.)

Closes-Bug: #1823997
Change-Id: Ic5fe9c8097de814ce3ad7032f42b31859051f70a

commit_message:
Run octavia-api under httpd

octavia-api's cli app doesn't behave well with haproxy so let's run
under apache and save ourselves some grief. Also adds cleanup for the
octavia-api tls proxy in update and upgrade tasks if it was previously
deployed.

Also updates zuul layout for multinode job to track changes to new
flattened octavia service files.

Closes-Bug: #1815811

Change-Id: Ied7cb31fbf1222694250e4769573bcbb82ba5bea

commit_message:
Add placeholder migrations for Stein backports

Seeing as these were missed for Rocky, we really ought to get them in
for Stein.

Change-Id: I29401773a0686e7be5d7d1cbb5ec82ffbb16fb4a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allocate bridge ip if port interface has ip

If you have just one network interface, you want to use
the interface as management network and external network both.
This patch allocate ip of bridge interface by ip of port interface .
Therefore user can use port interface ip address after bridge mapping.

Change-Id: I16543cc136a4caab78ef8d7c55e55a0a6b32f922
Signed-off-by: Hyunkook Cho <hk0713.cho@samsung.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/29/633429/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ip a s {{ $port }} 2> /dev/null ; then ovs-vsctl --no-wait --may-exist add-port {{ $bridge }} {{ $port }} ip link set dev {{ $port }} up br_interface_cidr="$(ip a s {{ $port }} 2> /dev/null | grep 'inet ' | awk '{print $2}')" if [ -n "${br_interface_cidr}" ] ; then ip addr del ${br_interface_cidr} dev {{ $port }} ip addr add ${br_interface_cidr} dev {{ $bridge }} ip link set dev {{ $bridge }} up fi fiLOCAL_IP=$(ip a s ${tunnel_interface} | grep 'inet ' | awk '{print $2}' | awk -F "/" '{print $1}')
deleted_lines: ovs-vsctl --no-wait --may-exist add-port {{ $bridge }} {{ $port }} ip link set dev {{ $port }} upLOCAL_IP=$(ip a s $tunnel_interface | grep 'inet ' | awk '{print $2}' | awk -F "/" '{print $1}')

commit_message:
Add zun's technical vision reflection

Per TC request [1], this is the reflection of Zun in accordance
with the OpenStack technical vision [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-January/001417.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/technical-vision.html

Change-Id: Ia8d6beff88f1624eee2c92a31b416bfe9fc531db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/43/648843/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. ======================== Technical Vision for Zun ======================== This document is a self-evaluation of Zun with regard to the Technical Committee's `technical vision`_ and serves as a basis for guiding the mission of the Zun project. .. _technical vision: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/technical-vision.html Mission Statement ================= Zun's mission is to provide an OpenStack containers service that integrates with various container technologies for managing application containers on OpenStack. Vision for OpenStack ==================== Self-service ------------ Zun are self-service. It provides a RESTful API service to provisioning and managing application containers. Zun containers are isolated between tenants. Containers controlled by one tenant are not accessible by other tenants. Quotas are used to limit the number of containers or compute resources (i.e. CPU, RAM) provisioned for containers within a tenant. Application Control ------------------- Zun allows application control of containers by offering RESTful API, CLI, and python binding. In addition, there are third-party tools (i.e. GopherCloud) provide API binding for other programming languages. The access of Zun's API is secured by Keystone so applications that are authenticatable with Keystone can access Zun's API securely. Interoperability ---------------- Zun containers (and other API resources) is designed to be deployable and portable to a variety of public and private OpenStack clouds. Zun is designed to hide differences between container engines and exposes standard container constructs via its API. Bidirectional Compatibility --------------------------- Zun implements API micro-version. API consumers can query the min/max API version, as well as pinning a specific API version to guarantee consistent API behavior across different OpenStack versions. Cross-Project Dependencies -------------------------- Zun depends on Keystone for authentication, Neutron for networking containers, Cinder for providing container volumes. In the future, Zun might depend on Placement for tracking compute resources. Partitioning ------------ It is totally fine to deploy Zun in multiple OpenStack regions, and each region could have a Zun endpoint in Keystone service catalog. Zun also supports groupings of resources by the concept of 'availability zones'. Basic Physical Data Center Management ------------------------------------- TBD Plays Well With Others ---------------------- TBD Hardware Virtualisation ----------------------- TBD Infinite, Continuous Scaling ---------------------------- TBD Built-in Reliability and Durability ----------------------------------- TBD Customizable Integration ------------------------ TBD Abstract Specialised Operations ------------------------------- TBD Graphical User Interface ------------------------ TBD

commit_message:
Fix init container in capsule

There is a regression that the init container logic was removed
from compute manager. This commit adds it back.

Change-Id: I435a273daab4b60d50ea8c68b6995097d28ff8e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/52/640652/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import tenacity for container in capsule.init_containers: self._create_container_in_capsule(context, capsule, container, requested_networks, requested_volumes) self._wait_for_init_container(context, container) def _wait_for_init_container(self, context, container, timeout=3600): def retry_if_result_is_false(result): return result is False def check_init_container_stopped(): status = self.show(context, container).status if status == consts.STOPPED: return True elif status == consts.RUNNING: return False else: raise exception.ZunException( _("Container has unexpected status: %s") % status) r = tenacity.Retrying( stop=tenacity.stop_after_delay(timeout), wait=tenacity.wait_exponential(), retry=tenacity.retry_if_result(retry_if_result_is_false)) r.call(check_init_container_stopped)

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Id44e4cb788fecda4c50655feee63d4d12de5ad33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder-ceph refs/changes/46/646146/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
